DOCNAME: CASE OF OLEYNIK AND BAYBARZA v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - Government to pay outstanding judgment debts;Non-pecuniary damage - financial awards
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON ( the first applicant ) and Mr PERSON ( the second applicant ) were born in DATE and DATE respectively , and live in FAC , LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Zhovti Vody City Court awarded the first applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL against ORG ( a ORG owned entity ; hereafter “ the Company ” ) in salary arrears . On DATE the second applicant was awarded CARDINAL against the ORG . Both judgments became final and were sent to FAC ( hereafter “ the Bailiffs ” ) for compulsory enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE FAC informed the second applicant that the delay in the execution of numerous court judgments against the Company was due to the moratorium on the forced sale of the property of ORG - owned enterprises , which significantly limited the resources for refunding the ORG ’s salary arrears .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , Transportation and Communications of ORG issued a letter , stating that improvement of the ORG ’s financial performance ( including that of its salary payments ) was a matter of concern for various ORG authorities . In particular , ORG was preparing the Company ’s development plan which was to be presented at the next ORG meeting .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) instituted bankruptcy proceedings against the ORG and issued an injunction barring any debt recovery . On DATE ORG approved a rehabilitation proposal and appointed a trustee to rehabilitate the ORG ’s business .
CARDINAL . The judgments given in the ORG favour remain unenforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgments of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
